Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BlpU (Gly-rich, natural AMPs; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: deletion from the genome followed by recombinant expression and chemical synthesis (85.9% pure) to verify activity.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (38.71%) toABP-118G: 30%, A: 15%. GRAVY: 0.33; mol Wt: 5139.859; mol formula: C230H355N67O63S2; mol ex coeff: 23815.Activity: Knock out lost activity against E. faecalis VA797, E. faecium H3, L. helveticus B1942, S. mutans GS-5, S. mutans UA159, and S. salivarius K-12.  Inhibition zone (50 ul of 100 ug/ml): synthetic peptide inhibited  S. thermophilus ST113, P. acidilactici, L. inoccua, and S. mutans.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed as GST-BlpU fusion protein, which was cleaved with Factor Xa protease. Est. 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Renye JA, Somkuti GA, Qi PX, Steinberg DH, McAnulty MJ, Miller AL, Guron GKP, Oest AM. 2024
Literature Information.Title: BlpU is a broad-spectrum bacteriocin in Streptococcus thermophilus
